properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 6:01PM EST until February 9 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a Flood
Warning for the following rivers in Georgia...

Chattahoochee River near Whitesburg affecting Carroll...Coweta and
Heard Counties

Flint River near Lovejoy affecting Clayton...Fayette and Spalding
Counties

Flint River near Griffin Hwy. 16 affecting Fayette and Spalding
Counties

Flint River near Molena affecting Meriwether and Pike Counties

Flint River near Carsonville Hwy. 19 affecting Crawford...
Talbot...Taylor and Upson Counties


.Recent heavy rainfall has caused significant runoff into streams and
rivers which will cause flooding in some areas.

The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a
* Flood Warning for
The Flint River near Griffin Hwy. 16.
* From late tonight until Sunday morning.
* At 445 PM Thursday the stage was 9.8 feet, and rising.
* Minor flooding is forecast to develop.
* Flood stage is 12 feet.
* The river is forecast to rise above flood stage after midnight
early Friday morning, then continue rising, reaching near 12.4 feet
later Friday morning. The river is expected to fall below flood
stage by Sunday morning.
* At 10 feet, bankfull conditions occur along the river upstream and
downstream from the gage at Georgia Highway 16, or Newnan Road.

At 12 feet, minor flooding begins in the woodlands, fields and
pastures upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway
16, or Newnan Road.

At 13 feet, minor flooding continues in the woodlands, fields and
pastures upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway
16, or Newnan Road. The backyards of homes at the end of Landing Way
upstream from the bridge will begin to flood.
properties.instruction:
All persons with interests along the river should monitor the latest
forecasts...and be prepared to take necessary precautions to protect
life and property.

The latest stage data was furnished in cooperation with the United
States Geological Survey.
